channel.title: Camcorder Help
channel.description:
okay so i got everything but juss wanted to kno what programs are best to take my camcorder and capture the video onto a hardrive with the BEST POSSIBLE quality?? i tried the program the camcorder came with but it was really shit quality ive also tried windows movie maker in capture mode was alrite but still fuzzyy so i was just wondering if you guys knoe any program that would be better then windows movie maker.. i juss was looking for a better quality after i capture it
thanks

item.title: Camcorder Help
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

It depends how you’re currently capturing it.

I mean it’s pretty much file > capture in any NLE.

And then you just log the clips you want to capture and capture them.

Read full topic

item.description:
@lawl wrote:

you also need a firewire port…

Read full topic

item.title: Camcorder Help
item.dc:creator: @darkilla darkilla
item.description:
@darkilla wrote:

alrite ill try to get one. so with firewire you do the same thing ? or do you have to capture it differently?

Read full topic

item.title: Camcorder Help
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Because it’s a USB stream. That’s not meant for capturing.

The reason why they use firewire for capturing is because it’s MUCH faster. It can send all the data to the computer real time for it to capture it. For the USB stream it’s probably compressed as shit to get anywhere near real time.

Get a firewire cable.

Read full topic

item.title: Camcorder Help
item.dc:creator: @darkilla darkilla
item.description:
@darkilla wrote:

well my camcorder lets me capture through USB lol its an option USB Stream…
ive tried Sony Vegas Movie Studio Platinum and it worked out a little better then the other programs. but still its not that great quality to burn onto a dvd n watch it on the television…
ive tried all the different types of qualities on the software and same outcome.

Read full topic

item.title: Camcorder Help
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

darkilla:

um im capturing thru USB and its a Mini DV digital Handycam

You can’t capture through USB…

You can either movie pictures you’ve taken from it over through USB, or if it’s a really shitty tapeless camcorder you can move the movie files across USB, but that’s still almost unheard of. But you just said it was MiniDV.

Capturing is done through firewire.

Read full topic

item.title: Camcorder Help
item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

darkilla:

um im capturing thru USB and its a Mini DV digital Handycam

All you can do with those programs is change the settings. I believe that your camera came with a cd for drivers and an editing program, so I guess you can mess around with the settings there but, overall what really matters is the quality of your camera.

[If you can post mp]

Read full topic

item.title: Camcorder Help
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

I’m assuming you’re capturing through firewire and it’s a DV camcorder.

I use a number of programs:

Final Cut Pro
Adobe Premiere Pro
HDVSplit
Cineform
